title: How to write a good article about health - Quora

response.answer_text: The key to writing great health articles researching and only using reputable sources. People make all kinds of claims online. Stick to resources like Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, CDC, WHO, US National Library of Medicine and sometimes WEBMD. In health, it’s also important to be very careful about your claims. Make sure you’re clear on the difference between “connection/link” and “cause & effect”. Just because a study can show a connection, doesn’t mean that something causes something else. This is very common in studies. In the US, at least, if something hasn’t been proven by the FDA, we have to say “may help ” or “can support” rather than stating that something cures or treats something. FDA can fine you for making unapproved claims, especially if you’re selling something. Disclaimers are also important.

There are two things you can do. First, write about something people are thinking about. What are they afraid will happen to them? What are the risks? What can they do to make the pain and the problem go away? Why take this angle? Because people don’t think about the dangers until they feel the pain. Then it’s real and they’re ready to do something about it. Second, use words people can understand. Doctors use lots of complicated words that confuse us, scare us, and make us look to them for definitive answers. When they hold the keys to a better future for you, you look to them as a savior who will rescue you from the darkness. You don’t want to confuse people. They won’t read your work when you do. If you’ve got to use a medical term, explain it so a child can understand. Use word pictures to make it clear. Then your words will sound more like a warm conversation over coffee than a sleep-inducing college lecture. Do these two things and you’ll have a fantastic article anyone will want to read.
